duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan and lead activities of the region’s TOC, evaluating and revising standard operating procedures for improved operational efficiency.
Lead TOC operations during severe weather and emergency operations, developing and leading exercises to assess TOC readiness.
Compile and oversee the compilation of performance metrics reporting related to TOC activities, and develop TOC budget for regional TOC activities.

Engage in management level interaction and coordination with public safety, law enforcement, transportation and emergency management representatives to ensure incident and emergency goals are achieved.
Manage contracts through which services of TOC and Safety Service Patrol (SSP) personnel are obtained, review and approve invoices, and resolve discrepancies.

Assist and serve as back-up for the TOC Incident Management Coordinator (IMC) in administering the Safety Service Patrol, Incident Management program during emergencies and special events for the region.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Transportation Management, Engineering, Public Works, Emergency Management or related field (Master's preferred)
